text: Well, I was at work one day I was doing my usual job working on the warehouse floor
keypoint: I worked my usual warehouse floor shift
I stocked boxes and organized merchandise

text: I had been working for a few hours it was getting late
keypoint: After hours, the evening was getting late

text: I had been feeling a bit strange a bit lightheaded but chalked it up to hunger not having eaten yet that day
keypoint: I felt lightheaded and blamed hunger

text: But then, as I was walking around the warehouse returning items to their proper places I started to feel a strange tightness and pressure in my chest
keypoint: While walking, chest tightness and pressure began

text: I stopped what I was doing leaned against a nearby wall for a bit the pressure only got stronger I could feel my heart pounding in my chest
keypoint: I stopped as pounding heart and pressure intensified

text: Next thing I know, I started seeing spots I could feel sweat dripping down my forehead my arms I tried to take some deep breaths
keypoint: Spots, sweat, and deep breaths failed to help

text: I just couldn't catch my breath I was really scared didn't know what to do.
keypoint: I couldn’t breathe and was terrified

text: Suddenly I heard a voice coming from across the warehouse. It was the manager who had seen me called out to me
keypoint: Manager saw me and called out

text: it seems someone had noticed me was checking to see if I was alright
keypoint: Someone checked whether I was alright

text: I tried to yell back that something was wrong I couldn't find my voice.
keypoint: I tried to answer but had no voice

text: The manager started walking towards me I could feel my world going dark I started to drop to the ground
keypoint: Manager approached while I began collapsing

text: luckily the manager got to me in time caught me just before my legs gave out
keypoint: He caught me before I hit the floor

text: He took me to the staff room sat me down in a chair He asked me questions about what was wrong
keypoint: He brought me to staff room and questioned me

text: what happened He got me a glass of cold water told me to rest for a bit
keypoint: He gave water and told me to rest

text: After a few minutes the pressure in my chest slowly eased up I started to feel better
keypoint: After minutes, chest pressure eased and I improved

text: It turned out I had been having a panic attack I escaped from the situation the help of the quick action of the manager
keypoint: Diagnosis: panic attack, manager’s quick actions saved me

text: It was never a fun experience it really could have been much worse it taught me to check in with myself
keypoint: The scary episode taught me self-care vigilance

text: make sure to properly rest eat to avoid further episodes
keypoint: I must rest and eat to prevent attacks
